Source code for user_auth.forms

from django import forms
from django.contrib.auth.forms import UserCreationForm
from django.contrib.auth.models import User


# Create your forms here.

[docs]class NewUserForm(UserCreationForm):
	"""
    Class providing the form for a new user to register.
    """
	first_name = forms.CharField()


[docs]	class Meta:
		"""
    	Class representing the fields that need to be completed to register initially.

			:param str first_name: This name is use to Welcome the user when logged in
			:param str username: This is the name that will be used to log in in the future
			:param str password1: The password that the user would like to use to log in in the future
			:param str password2: The password to confirm that the user correctly entered the password the first time
    	"""
		model = User
		fields = ("first_name", "username", "password1", "password2")



[docs]	def save(self, commit=True):
		"""
    	Save the new user details and make sure that the user is not registered as a super user.
    	"""
		user = super(NewUserForm, self).save(commit=False)
		user.first_name = self.cleaned_data['first_name']
		if commit:
			user.save()
		return user
